events.name: Time to get hands-on - Cloud Study Jam

venue.name: Google Office, 2nd Floor, Building 9, Canon Building

events.description:
What is Cloud Study Jam about?
--------------------------------------------
Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering.

What you will learn:
---------------------------
- Learn how to set up development and production environments in the Cloud.
- Learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the Cloud.
- Get access to Qwiklabs, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value).
- Get Google-hosted badges for your online profile, to show potential employers what you know about Cloud computing.
- Pave a path towards getting Google Cloud Certification

How long does it take?
--------------------------------
One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.
Agenda:
6:00pm: Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs
7:30pm: Break
8:00pm: Intro to Docker or Scientific Data Processing lab
9:00pm: Event ends

*** Remember to bring your laptop ***
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

events.name: Build a Google Assistant: Case Study from UAQ Economic Development

venue.name: Google HQ Dubai
venue.address_1: Google Master Card Building - Dubai Internet City building 4 - 3rd Floor

events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
During the meet-up we will present our journey on building a Google Assistant App for the Government:
Google Assistant Introduction
Voice Strategy
Voice UI
Develop a conversation agent using DialogFlow.
Develop a fulfillment application using Google Actions API.
Deploy a Google Assistant Application.

Speakers:

Ndjido Ardo Bar - Google Developer Expert Machine Learning:

Ndjido Ardo BAR is a Lead Data Science at Davidson UAE and is at the moment working in a project related to the Dubai Smart City project.

Ndjido earned a Master Degree in Applied Mathematics at Gaston Berger University in Senegal. His strong background in Maths is coupled with an excellent programming skill in languages like C/C++, Scala, Python. Ndjido loves functional programming and has the chance to use language like Scala to deliver most of Data Science project he is involved in.

He has 7 years experience doing Data Science project, starting at Pasteur Institut as a researcher in BioStatistics. Around 2011 he co-founded a startup specialised in real-time agriculture online market (MLouma). In late 2012, Ndjido joined BearingPoint a French consulting company as a Data Scientist in its Machine Learning team named Hypercube. He was in charge of different activities: developing Algorithms, training customers in Data Science, delivering Machine Learning modelling to different customers. In late 2015, Ndjido joined AXA France as a Data Scientist and delivered a Credit Scoring Model build from customer-centric data and financial KPIs using a Deep Belief Network and a Gradient boosting model.

Ndjido is not only passionated by Maths and AI, he is also an open source activist and love to speak in meetups and conferences what he has learnt from hours and hours of reading and practicing. It's a way for him to give back to community.

Baghdad Gherras - Google Developer Expert Product Design:

Baghdad GHERRAS is a Data Product Manager and Practice Head - Data Science and Machine Learning for a French Consulting Company based in Dubai. He built the first Data Science Consulting team in UAE and worked with private companies as well as government institutions.

He is currently serving as Engagement Manager for Road and Transport Authority in Dubai where he is building Data Science Capabilities. His recent accomplishments include the creation of an Artificial Intelligence Excellence Center and the design of Data Products for Dubai Smart City. He is passionate about the intersection of Machine Learning, Design Thinking and UX Design.

Baghdad is also an Adjunct Professor in Smart Cities at IE University in the MSc Global Business Analytics and Big Data. He is a Google Cloud Developer Lead, member of the Singularity University Dubai Chapter and Organizer of the UAE Data Science Meet-up Group.

He studied Applied Economy at the Business & Management School of Lyon (France), Strategy at the IMBA Lingnan-MIT Sloan (Guangzhou, China), Financial Engineering at the University of Lyon (France) and Data Science via Coursera and the Ecole Polytechnique Summer School.
‚Ä¢ What to bring

‚Ä¢ Important to know

events.name: Google Cloud OnBoard - Dubai

venue.name: The Address Dubai Marina

events.description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
This is a Google Event.

Registration must be completed @ the Google webSite: https://goo.gl/eei7Hg

Cloud OnBoard - Dubai
Start_Training {
Learn how to Build What‚Äôs Next with Google
} //Cloud OnBoard - Dubai is a free full-day instructor-led enablement and training event that will provide you with a step-by-step technical introduction to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Through a combination of instructor-led presentations and technical demonstrations, you will learn how to get started with Google App Engine, Datastore, Storage, Kubernetes Engine, Compute Engine and Network, Big Data and Machine Learning.

Cloud OnBoard has been designed for IT Managers, Systems Engineers and Operations professionals, Developers, Solution Architects and modern business leaders who are exploring cloud solutions or are new to Google Cloud Platform. Leveraging the GCP Fundamentals course, the event will provide you with the technical training you need to get started as well as access to tips and tricks, industry best-practice and questions and answers from the GCP team.

Cloud OnBoard is a full day training course, held on April[masked] AM - 06.00 PM
Registration Opens at 08:00 AM
Module 1 Introducing Google Cloud Platform
Module 2 Getting Started with GCP: Projects and Products
Break
Module 3 GCP Infrastructure as a Service: Google Compute Engine
Module 4 Containers on GCP: Google Kubernetes Engine
Lunch
Module 5 GCP Platform as a Service: Google App Engine
Module 6 Storage Options on GCP: Cloud Storage, SQL and more!
Break
Module 7 GCP Big Data: BigQuery, DataFlow and Pub/Sub
Module 8 Machine Learning APIs on GCP: Vision, Translate and more!
Training & Certification Igniting your Career with Google Cloud

‚Ä¢ What to bring

‚Ä¢ Important to know

events.name: Google UX Masterclass Design Thinking class - Startups ONLY
events.description:
Looking to sharpen your UX skills?
Good news! Two leading UX designers from Google will be conducting a 2-day hands-on user experience masterclass. This is a free event.

In recent years, design and user-centered thinking have been embraed by business leaders‚Äìnot just as a way to do design, but as a way to create an effective product development strategy. By attending this class with your cross-functional team, you will learn basic user-centered design processes and how to apply them throughout your entire product development cycle.

We will cover the process of taking product ideas from concept to launch, including sketching, user testing, prototyping, and making continuous improvements after launch to keep your users engaged and satisfied.

Is my startup a good fit?
This class is geared towards startups and companies that would like to improve their product development and shipping process with design thinking, and to establish a more user-centered process. We encourage teams of 4-6 stakeholders representing a wide range of functions (engineers, product managers, designers) to attend. Attendance is limited and it is free to participate, so complete the application form to be considered.

Applications will be closed by June 15th.

Please note: If selected, your team will be required to complete a pre-workshop exercise prior to the first day of class.

Topics we'll cover
We plan to cover a wide range of topics over the 2-days with a focus on the following: the process of taking product ideas from concept to launch, including sketching user testing and prototyping how to drive continuous improvements after launch to keep your users engaged

Full agenda available here: https://events.withgoogle.com/ux-masterclass-2018/

Interested in Class 6 (UAE/SA, Egypt)? Please apply here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSde_euBqbeVUfUv0gN2BtEcyeaWcfkY3oyYoenPC0AAZ9ZRNw/viewform

Well, bring your ideas to the hackathon and increase your chances to get selected by registering by the end of Saturday Jul 14th using "GDG" tag in the registration form where the question is "From where did you hear about us?".

IMPORTANT*** We are not responsible for organizing this Hackathon, we are just sharing the announcements with you, so if you have any questions regarding it check all the details on the website mentioned above.

events.name: Introduction to Service Mesh for Microservices Using Kubernetes and Istio

venue.name: Google HQ Dubai
venue.address_1: Google Master Card Building - Dubai Internet City building 4 - 3rd Floor

events.description:
Level - Beginner to Intermediate
Format - Presentation (1 hour) + Hands-on (1 hour)

In this session we will introduce the concept of service mesh and its use with Microservices. The tentative schedule for the session:
1- Introduction to Kubernetes - https://kubernetes.io/
2- Overview of Microservices
3- Requirement for Service Mesh
4- Introduction to Istio - https://istio.io/
5- [1 hour] hands-on to run the Istio/Kubernetes example microservices locally

For the hands-on Codelab there are two options to do it, either on the cloud or locally on your laptop
1- For the Cloud, sign up for Google Cloud account: https://console.cloud.google.com/
2- For running locally, setup Minikube as described here: https://istio.io/docs/setup/kubernetes/platform-setup/minikube/

events.name: Flutter Study Jam '18

venue.name: Google Dubai Office - Meydan meeting room
venue.address_2: Dubai Internet City, Office 306, Building 4 (Master Card Building), Floor 4 -Sheikh Zayed Rd - Dubai

events.description:
We are pleased to have Ahmed Abu Eldahab, Egypt Flutter community lead and Expert, conduct the Flutter Study Jam.

Location: Google Office.
Limited to first 40 responders.

Flutter is Google‚Äôs mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

Agenda:
6:00pm: Flutter Course Introduction
6:10pm: Course Lesson 1
7:30pm: Break
8:00pm: Course Lesson 1 continue
10:00pm: Event ends

events.name: Blockchain: Moving Towards Distributed Decentralized Applications

venue.name: Google Dubai Office - Meydan meeting room
venue.address_2: Dubai Internet City, Office 306, Building 4 (Master Card Building), Floor 4 -Sheikh Zayed Rd - Dubai

events.description:
The Blockchain is a technology based on the virtual digitized decentralized network with 'blocks' of information. It is one of the biggest buzzwords in technology over the last few years with applications in different sectors. This talk will introduce blockchain technology, its underlying infrastructure, and some of its applications. The second half of the presentation will concentrate on the development of blockchain based applications.

Speaker:

Muhammad Adnan is working as a Senior Data Scientist Consultant at RTA. Previously, he has worked for Marks and Spencer, Shell, and University College London on a number of Data Science roles. In data science, his areas of interest are Neural Networks, demand forecasting & predictive analytics, and using blockchain for data science solutions.

Are you interested in solving problems? Have a passion for computer science and looking for a challenge? Register for Google Code Jam, Google‚Äôs longest running global coding competition, and attend the UAE's first Code Jam meetup on Saturday April 6th at Google Dubai.

Programmers from across the UAE will have the unique opportunity to meet other passionate individuals and work together to solve the problems for the qualification round of the Google Code Jam. Participants will learn important algorithm-problem strategies that they can use to succeed throughout the rest of the contest.

organizers.name: Omer D.
organizers.bio: Father of 3, technical consultant, digital guru and inspiring developers. https://github.com/omerio

group_profile.intro: I've been a technology Consultant for the past 16+ years and Google Developer Expert for Cloud. I've a PhD in Computer Science. I'm passionate about Google technologies and been using AngularJS, App Engine, Compute Engine, BigQuery for many years.

organizers.name: Baghdad
organizers.bio:
Dear All,

I'm leading the Data Science practice in a IT Consultancy firm.
I will be glade to share about Big Data and Machine Learning.

Regards,

organizers.name: Abdelrahman O.
organizers.bio: I'm a proficient multi-skilled Software Architect, speaker, and Google Developer Expert in Web, Identity, and Assistant. I worked with Intel, TIEC, UNDP, and currently working on my own company ‚ÄùRinvex‚Äù, specialized in enterprise solutions for SMEs.
